law.catch_line: Duty of applicant to meet and confer with well operator if permit will disturb access roads.
law.text: Prior to the issuance of a permit, if the operation will disturb any roads used as access to an oil or gas well or other oil and gas facility, the permit applicant shall certify that he has met and conferred with, or offered to meet and confer with, the well operator as to the disturbance.
law.history: Created 1992 Ky. Acts ch. 348, sec. 1, effective July 14, 1992.
